segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Best Practices
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Best Practices

segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Best Practices
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Best Practices

segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Best Practices
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Best Practices

segment.source: This section describes some best practices related to servicing a Windows® image.
segment.target: This section describes some best practices related to servicing a Windows® image.

segment.source: We recommend that you implement these practices wherever possible.
segment.target: We recommend that you implement these practices wherever possible.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.target: Elevate Permissions for Command-Line Tools

segment.target: Disable Antivirus Tools

segment.target: Changing International Settings

segment.target: Improving Security for Windows Images

segment.source: Elevate Permissions for Command-Line Tools
segment.target: Elevate Permissions for Command-Line Tools

segment.source: Many deployment command-line tools, including Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM), require elevated permissions.
segment.target: Many deployment command-line tools, including Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM), require elevated permissions.

segment.source: Make sure that you have elevated permissions.
segment.target: Make sure that you have elevated permissions.

segment.source: Click Start, and type deployment.
segment.target: Click Start, and type deployment.

segment.source: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.

segment.source: This must be done even if you are logged on as an administrator.
segment.target: This must be done even if you are logged on as an administrator.

segment.source: Disable Antivirus Tools
segment.target: Disable Antivirus Tools

segment.source: Some DISM commands may be blocked by antivirus or antimalware tools.
segment.target: Some DISM commands may be blocked by antivirus or antimalware tools.

segment.source: Before servicing an image, disable antivirus or antimalware tools on the technician computer.
segment.target: Before servicing an image, disable antivirus or antimalware tools on the technician computer.

segment.source: Servicing an Image
segment.target: Servicing an Image

segment.source: The best way to service a Windows image is offline with the DISM tool.
segment.target: The best way to service a Windows image is offline with the DISM tool.

segment.source: DISM can be used to install, uninstall, configure, and update drivers, features, and packages in Windows images and Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) images without booting the image.
segment.target: DISM can be used to install, uninstall, configure, and update drivers, features, and packages in Windows images and Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) images without booting the image.

segment.source: For more information, see DISM - Deployment Image Servicing and Management Technical Reference for Windows.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM - Deployment Image Servicing and Management Technical Reference for Windows.

segment.source: You can use the /Commit-Image option at any point during servicing to save the changes that you have made so far.
segment.target: You can use the /Commit-Image option at any point during servicing to save the changes that you have made so far.

segment.source: You can recover a corrupted image more easily with the /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth option if you have committed your changes often.
segment.target: You can recover a corrupted image more easily with the /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth option if you have committed your changes often.

segment.source: You can mount and modify multiple images on a single computer.
segment.target: You can mount and modify multiple images on a single computer.

segment.source: However, performance may slow down on some functions, such as /Unmount-Image, depending on the memory available on the computer.
segment.target: However, performance may slow down on some functions, such as /Unmount-Image, depending on the memory available on the computer.

segment.source: As a best practice, you should not mount more than 20 images at the same time.
segment.target: As a best practice, you should not mount more than 20 images at the same time.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you have split a .wim file into smaller files for spanning across multiple media, you cannot mount the image for servicing.
segment.target: If you have split a .wim file into smaller files for spanning across multiple media, you cannot mount the image for servicing.

segment.source: Changing International Settings
segment.target: Changing International Settings

segment.source: To change the international settings in Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows 7, and Windows Server 2008 R2 images, you must use DISM.
segment.target: To change the international settings in Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows 7, and Windows Server 2008 R2 images, you must use DISM.

segment.source: For more information, see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Use Log Files
segment.target: Use Log Files

segment.source: DISM will log verbose information to %WINDIR%LogsDismDism.log by default.
segment.target: DISM will log verbose information to %WINDIR%LogsDismDism.log by default.

segment.source: You can also specify a name and location of your choice for the log file, and set the /loglevel parameters so that only the information you are interested in is logged.
segment.target: You can also specify a name and location of your choice for the log file, and set the /loglevel parameters so that only the information you are interested in is logged.

segment.source: When an error occurs, the console will display the error code, error message, and the location of the log file.
segment.target: When an error occurs, the console will display the error code, error message, and the location of the log file.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you specify a log path on a network share from a computer that is not joined to a domain, use net-use with domain credentials to set access permissions before you set the log path for the DISM log.
segment.target: If you specify a log path on a network share from a computer that is not joined to a domain, use net-use with domain credentials to set access permissions before you set the log path for the DISM log.

segment.source: The log file will automatically be archived.
segment.target: The log file will automatically be archived.

segment.source: The archived log file will be saved with .bak appended to the file name, and a new log file will be generated.
segment.target: The archived log file will be saved with .bak appended to the file name, and a new log file will be generated.

segment.source: Each time the log file is archived, the .bak file will be overwritten.
segment.target: Each time the log file is archived, the .bak file will be overwritten.

segment.source: The log file gives you the history of the operations that have been performed, which can help you troubleshoot problems.
segment.target: The log file gives you the history of the operations that have been performed, which can help you troubleshoot problems.

segment.source: Package Locations
segment.target: Package Locations

segment.source: Do not put a package that you intend to install directly at the root of a partition on a Windows installation.
segment.target: Do not put a package that you intend to install directly at the root of a partition on a Windows installation.

segment.source: Storing Files on a Network Share
segment.target: Storing Files on a Network Share

segment.source: Although DISM supports network paths for images and packages, most operations will perform faster on files that are copied to the local hard-drive.
segment.target: Although DISM supports network paths for images and packages, most operations will perform faster on files that are copied to the local hard-drive.

segment.source: Servicing a Windows Image from WinPE
segment.target: Servicing a Windows Image from WinPE

segment.source: You can service Windows images from WinPE.
segment.target: You can service Windows images from WinPE.

segment.source: However, you must consider certain factors while planning your servicing strategy.
segment.target: However, you must consider certain factors while planning your servicing strategy.

segment.source: Review the following requirements for servicing an image from WinPE.
segment.target: Review the following requirements for servicing an image from WinPE.

segment.source: Booting WinPE from a Hard Drive
segment.target: Booting WinPE from a Hard Drive

segment.source: For better performance, you can allocate additional memory when you boot WinPE from a hard disk drive.
segment.target: For better performance, you can allocate additional memory when you boot WinPE from a hard disk drive.

segment.source: You can also create temporary folders to store update files to accommodate large updates.
segment.target: You can also create temporary folders to store update files to accommodate large updates.

segment.source: Add Page-File Support to Your WinPE Image
segment.target: Add Page-File Support to Your WinPE Image

segment.source: Make sure you have sufficient memory to load and run your custom WinPE image.
segment.target: Make sure you have sufficient memory to load and run your custom WinPE image.

segment.source: In addition to the image size, you should have at least 256 MB of available working memory.
segment.target: In addition to the image size, you should have at least 256 MB of available working memory.

segment.source: If you have limited memory, define a page file (Pagefile.sys) to improve memory management.
segment.target: If you have limited memory, define a page file (Pagefile.sys) to improve memory management.

segment.source: For more information on implementing a page file, see Wpeutil Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information on implementing a page file, see Wpeutil Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Create a Temporary Directory in Which to Store Update Files
segment.target: Create a Temporary Directory in Which to Store Update Files

segment.source: You should use the /ScratchDir option with DISM to create a temporary directory on a different drive when you create or service a Windows image.
segment.target: You should use the /ScratchDir option with DISM to create a temporary directory on a different drive when you create or service a Windows image.

segment.source: A temporary directory is used for many DISM operations including capturing an image, installing language packs, installing updates, or installing or removing Windows features in a Windows image.
segment.target: A temporary directory is used for many DISM operations including capturing an image, installing language packs, installing updates, or installing or removing Windows features in a Windows image.

segment.source: Some files are expanded to this temporary directory before they are applied to a Windows image.
segment.target: Some files are expanded to this temporary directory before they are applied to a Windows image.

segment.source: There must be sufficient space in the partition to accommodate large updates.
segment.target: There must be sufficient space in the partition to accommodate large updates.

segment.source: The specific size of the free space that is required depends on the size of the updates that you intend to install.
segment.target: The specific size of the free space that is required depends on the size of the updates that you intend to install.

segment.source: When adding a language pack, the scratch directory must have at least 1 GB of space for temporary files.
segment.target: When adding a language pack, the scratch directory must have at least 1 GB of space for temporary files.

segment.source: If you do not set a temporary directory path using the /ScratchDir option, WinPE creates a 32-MB temporary directory by default.
segment.target: If you do not set a temporary directory path using the /ScratchDir option, WinPE creates a 32-MB temporary directory by default.

segment.source: You can allocate additional temporary storage to this default location using the DISM /Set-ScratchSpace option.
segment.target: You can allocate additional temporary storage to this default location using the DISM /Set-ScratchSpace option.

segment.source: Valid sizes include 32, 64, 128, 256, and 512 MB.
segment.target: Valid sizes include 32, 64, 128, 256, and 512 MB.

segment.source: This feature is available only offline and you cannot adjust this setting while a WinPE session is running.
segment.target: This feature is available only offline and you cannot adjust this setting while a WinPE session is running.

segment.source: As a best practice, you should use the /ScratchDir option to instead specify a directory on another partition that has sufficient space to support any image management and servicing operations you perform.
segment.target: As a best practice, you should use the /ScratchDir option to instead specify a directory on another partition that has sufficient space to support any image management and servicing operations you perform.

segment.source: After installation is complete, the contents of this directory are no longer needed and can be deleted.
segment.target: After installation is complete, the contents of this directory are no longer needed and can be deleted.

segment.source: For more information, see DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Booting WinPE from a CD-ROM/DVD
segment.target: Booting WinPE from a CD-ROM/DVD

segment.source: Servicing a Windows image requires additional temporary storage space.
segment.target: Servicing a Windows image requires additional temporary storage space.

segment.source: For WinPE RAM disks, you might need additional RAM.
segment.target: For WinPE RAM disks, you might need additional RAM.

segment.source: In addition to the RAM requirements of your WinPE image, additional RAM is required to process updates.
segment.target: In addition to the RAM requirements of your WinPE image, additional RAM is required to process updates.

segment.source: The amount of RAM that is required depends on the size of the updates that you intend to apply.
segment.target: The amount of RAM that is required depends on the size of the updates that you intend to apply.

segment.source: Ensure that your computer has sufficient RAM.
segment.target: Ensure that your computer has sufficient RAM.

segment.source: Scan for Corruption and Verify the Integrity of System Files
segment.target: Scan for Corruption and Verify the Integrity of System Files

segment.source: Before you deliver a computer to an end user, you should verify the integrity of Windows system files.
segment.target: Before you deliver a computer to an end user, you should verify the integrity of Windows system files.

segment.source: You can use the /Cleanup-Image option to identify file corruption and perform repair operations on the image.
segment.target: You can use the /Cleanup-Image option to identify file corruption and perform repair operations on the image.

segment.source: For more information about the /Cleanup-Image option in DISM, see DISM Operating System Package Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information about the /Cleanup-Image option in DISM, see DISM Operating System Package Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: You can also use System File Checker (Sfc.exe) on an online or offline reference image.
segment.target: You can also use System File Checker (Sfc.exe) on an online or offline reference image.

segment.source: System File Checker is released with all versions of Windows.System File Checker requires elevated permissions, and you must be an Administrator to run it.
segment.target: System File Checker is released with all versions of Windows.System File Checker requires elevated permissions, and you must be an Administrator to run it.

segment.source: It scans all protected files to verify the file versions.
segment.target: It scans all protected files to verify the file versions.

segment.source: To verify only the integrity of the Windows system files, run the sfc.exe /verifyonly option.
segment.target: To verify only the integrity of the Windows system files, run the sfc.exe /verifyonly option.

segment.source: For complete command-line syntax, at an elevated command prompt, type sfc.exe /?.
segment.target: For complete command-line syntax, at an elevated command prompt, type sfc.exe /?.

segment.source: Running Sfc.exe can take a significant amount of time.
segment.target: Running Sfc.exe can take a significant amount of time.

segment.source: The expected result is that there are no system integrity violations.
segment.target: The expected result is that there are no system integrity violations.

segment.source: However, if there are problems with Windows system files, you should investigate the issues.
segment.target: However, if there are problems with Windows system files, you should investigate the issues.

segment.source: We do not recommend that you use the Sfc.exe scan options to automatically fix Windows system files.
segment.target: We do not recommend that you use the Sfc.exe scan options to automatically fix Windows system files.

segment.source: Improving Security for Windows Images
segment.target: Improving Security for Windows Images

segment.source: Your Windows images contain custom configuration data, custom applications, and other intellectual property.
segment.target: Your Windows images contain custom configuration data, custom applications, and other intellectual property.

segment.source: There are several ways to improve the security of your Windows images, both online and offline.
segment.target: There are several ways to improve the security of your Windows images, both online and offline.

segment.source: Restrict access to Windows images.
segment.target: Restrict access to Windows images.

segment.source: Depending on your environment, you can edit the access control lists (ACLs) or permissions on a file.
segment.target: Depending on your environment, you can edit the access control lists (ACLs) or permissions on a file.

segment.source: Only approved accounts can have access to Windows images.
segment.target: Only approved accounts can have access to Windows images.

segment.source: Update your Windows images with the latest fixes and software updates.
segment.target: Update your Windows images with the latest fixes and software updates.

segment.source: There are many ways you can service a Windows image.
segment.target: There are many ways you can service a Windows image.

segment.source: After servicing your Windows image, test the validity and stability of the computer.
segment.target: After servicing your Windows image, test the validity and stability of the computer.

segment.source: During Windows installation, configure the computer to automatically download and install Windows updates.
segment.target: During Windows installation, configure the computer to automatically download and install Windows updates.

segment.source: This extends installation time, but ensures that the Windows image that you are installing contains the latest updates.
segment.target: This extends installation time, but ensures that the Windows image that you are installing contains the latest updates.

segment.source: For more information, see the setting in the Microsoft-Windows-Setup component in the Unattended Windows Setup Reference.
segment.target: For more information, see the setting in the Microsoft-Windows-Setup component in the Unattended Windows Setup Reference.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: DISM - Deployment Image Servicing and Management Technical Reference for Windows
